name: Carrot Biryani
instructions: Heat the oil in a large frying pan, tip in the onion with a big pinch of salt and fry until softened, around 5 mins, then add the chilli and crush in the garlic and cook for 1 min more
Stir in the spices with a splash of water and cook for a couple of mins before adding the carrots and stirring well to coat in all of the spices and flavours

Tip in the rice, peas and cashews, then use the back of your spoon to break up any clumps of rice and combine with the rest of the ingredients, cover and cook over a high heat for 5 mins (it’s nice if a bit of rice catches on the base to give a bit of texture to the dish)
Scatter over the coriander with spoonfuls of yogurt, then serve straight from the pan
Good for 1 serving

name: Pork Stir-Fry with Vegetables
ingredients: mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, snap peas, carrots)
quantity: 2 chopped bell peppers, 2 broccoli, 2 snap peas, “2 carrots”, “3 cloves of galic
instructions: In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), rice vinegar, sesame oil, and cornstarch (if desired)
Set aside
Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat
Spray with cooking spray or add vegetable oil
Add minced garlic and sliced onion to the skillet
Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant
Add thinly sliced pork loin to the skillet
Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until pork is browned and cooked through
Add mixed vegetables to the skillet
Stir-fry for an additional 3-4 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp
Pour the sauce mixture over the pork and vegetables in the skillet
Stir well to combine and coat everything evenly
Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot, optionally garnished with sliced green onions or sesame seeds
Good for 1 serving

name: Orange Chicken
instructions: In an extra-large nonstick skillet or wok, heat oil over medium-high
Add chicken, pepper strips, and pea pods
Cook and stir for about 5 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink
Stir the sauce mixture and add to the pan
Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes or until thickened and bubbly
Serve over rice
For sauce, in a small bowl stir together orange zest, orange juice, the water, honey, soy sauce, vinegar, cornstarch, garlic, ginger, and crushed red pepper
Good for 1 serving

name: Sisig
instructions: Boil pork face until tender
Grill or fry until crispy
Chop finely, Saute onions and chili peppers
Mix with chopped pork face, calamansi juice, mayonnaise, soy sauce, salt, and pepper
Good for 1 serving

name: Tortang Talong
instructions: Grill or roast the eggplants until soft, Peel off the skin, Flatten the eggplant and dip in beaten eggs seasoned with salt and pepper, Pan fry until cooked,
Good for 1 serving

name: Healthy Fish & Chips with Tartare Sauce
instructions: Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6
Toss chips in oil
Spread over a baking sheet in an even layer, bake for 40 mins until browned and crisp
Put the fish in a shallow dish, brush lightly with oil, salt and pepper
Sprinkle with half the lemon juice, bake for 12-15 mins, After 10 mins sprinkle over a little parsley and lemon zest to finish cooking
Meanwhile, mix the capers, yogurt, remaining parsley and lemon juice together, set aside and season if you wish
To serve, divide the chips between plates, lift the fish onto the plates and serve with a spoonful of yogurt mix
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginger Roasted Salmon & Broccoli
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F
Coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray
Whisk oil, tamari, vinegar, ginger and 1/8 teaspoon salt in a large bowl
Add broccoli and toss to coat
Transfer to the prepared pan using tongs or a slotted spoon, leaving as much marinade as possible in the bowl
Whisk molasses into the remaining marinade
Roast the broccoli for 5 minutes
Move it to one side of the pan and place salmon on the other side
Season the salmon with the remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt and brush with the molasses glaze
Roast until the salmon is just cooked through, 7 to 10 minutes more
Sprinkle with sesame seed
Good for 1 serving

name: Toaster-Oven Tostadas
instructions: Line a toaster-oven pan with foil and arrange tortillas on it
Top the tortillas with beans and cheese
Toast until the cheese is melted and the tortillas are starting to brown along the edges, 7 to 8 minutes
Meanwhile, place greens in an individual salad bowl
Drizzle lime juice and oil over the greens
Remove the tostadas from the toaster oven and top with avocado and pico de gallo (or salsa)
Serve hot with the dressed greens
Good for 1 serving

name: Beef Nilaga
instructions: In a big casserole, place beef and pour in water
The water level should be just above the meat
Bring to boil and let it simmer for 10 minutes then remove scum (frothy fat) on top while simmering
Add onions, cover, and simmer for 1 to 1 and 1/2 hours or until beef is tender
Add more water and potatoes, continue to simmer until potatoes are cooked
Add peppercorns and fish sauce
Place the cabbage then the pechay just when you are about to serve
Do not overcook the vegetables, Adjust the taste with salt
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginataang kalabasa at sitaw
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, Add pork
Cook until brown and crispy
1 tablespoon cooking oil, 3 ounces pork,Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger,1 piece onion, 5 cloves garlic, 2 thumbs ginger
Once the onion softens, pour the coconut milk into the pan
Stir, Cover the pan and let the liquid boil
Once boiling, adjust the heat to medium and continue boiling for 5 minutes,4 cups coconut milk
Add Knorr Pork Cube and squash
Continue cooking for 5 minutes,1 piece Knorr Pork cube, 1 1/2 lbs, squash
Add string beans, Cook for 5 to 8 minutes,18 pieces string beans
Season with ground black pepper and fish sauce as needed,¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
Fish sauce to taste
Transfer to a serving plate
Serve with warm rice
Good for 1 serving

name: Filipino Spaghetti
instructions: Cook the Spaghetti noodles according to package instructions, Once cooked, transfer to a bowl
Set aside,Heat the oil in a Pan
Saute the onion and garlic
Once the onions becomes soft, add the ground pork
Cook until the color turns light brown
Add the luncheon meat and hotdog
Stir and cook for 2 to 3 minutes
Pour-in the Spaghetti sauce and beef broth
Stir and let boil
Cover and simmer for 30 minutes
Try to taste the sauce and add salt and pepper if needed
Pour the Filipino Style Spaghetti sauce over the Spaghetti
Top with shredded cheese
Serve
Share and enjoy!
Good for 1 serving

name: Kare kare
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil
Put in the oxtail followed by the onions and simmer for 2,5 to 3 hrs or until tender (35 minutes if using a pressure cooker)
Once the meat is tender, add the ground peanuts, peanut butter, and coloring (water from the annatto seed mixture) and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes,Add the toasted ground rice and simmer for 5 minutes
On a separate pan, saute the garlic then add the banana flower, eggplant, and string beans and cook for 5 minutes
Transfer the cooked vegetables to the large pot (where the rest of the ingredients are)
Add salt and pepper to taste
Good for 1 serving

name: Stuffed Chicken Thighs (This recipe may have a potential high fat content.)
instructions: Flatten 2 chicken thighs and spoon the stuffing onto each thigh
Roll up the thighs in to the 1 cup of seasoned flour and secure with toothpicks
Sear the chicken thighs until golden brown on all sides
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 25 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through
Remove the toothpicks before serving
Good for 1 serving

name: Fried Pork with Barbecue Sauce
instructions: Season the chopped pork  with salt, pepper, and any desired spices
Fry the pork breast until golden brown and cooked through
Peel and cube 4 sweet potatoes, toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, and any desired herbs or spices
Roast sweet potatoes in pan until tender
Serve fried pork breast with roasted sweet potatoes
Good for 1 serving

name: Grilled Salmon
instructions: Marinate salmon fillet with lemon, olive oil, garlic, and dill
Grill salmon until cooked through
Good for 1 serving

name: Pork and Vegetable Stir Fry with Noodles
instructions: Stir fry marinated ½ of pork chopped until cooked through
Add sliced vegetables (such as bell peppers, snap peas, and mushrooms) and stir fry until tender crisp
Toss in cooked noodles and stir fry sauce (made with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil)
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Veggie and Cheese Omelette
instructions: Pour the 2 whisked eggs into the skillet and let cook for a minute
Sprinkle chopped vegetables (such as bell peppers, tomatoes) and grated cheese over one half of the omelette
Fold the other half over the filling and cook until the cheese melts
Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve
Good for 1 serving

name: Chicken Drumsticks in Breadcrumbs Served with Roasted Vegetables
instructions: Coat 3 pieces of chicken drumsticks with bread crumbs seasoned with salt, pepper, and any desired spices
Arrange potatoes, carrots, and onions around the chicken
Drizzle vegetables with olive oil and season with salt and pepper
Cook it in the walk pan altogether and serve it while hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Egg Fried Rice
quantity: 1 and ½ of chopped green onions
instructions: Stir fry cooked rice with 2 scrambled eggs, chopped green onions, and 1 table spoon of soy sauce for a quick and filling meal
Cook it altogether and Serve it while hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Avocado Toast with Scrambled Eggs
instructions: Toast the 2 bread slices until golden brown
Mash 1 ripe avocado and spread them evenly onto the toasted bread
Cook 2 scrambled eggs to your preferred consistency and place them on top of the avocado
Serve it by cutting the sandwich in the middle
Good for 1 serving

name: Butter Toasted Bread Sticks with Cheese Dipping Sauce
instructions: Slice bread into sticks and lightly toast them in a skillet with butter until crispy
For the cheese dipping sauce, melt cheese with a bit of 1 can of milk or cream until smooth and creamy
Serve the toasted bread sticks alongside the cheese dipping sauce
Good for 1 serving

name: Mushroom Chicken
instructions: Preheat a large pan over medium heat
Season the chicken using 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp oregano, 1/4 tsp cumin, sea salt and pepper to taste
Sprinkle everything on both sides of the chicken and rub to make sure it’s all covered evenly
Add 1 Tbsp of butter to the hot pan and fry the chicken for 6-7 minutes on one side
Flip and fry for another 6-7 minutes on the other side until the chicken is golden brown, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165 F
In the meantime, cut mushrooms about 1/4″ slices and set aside
Then, finely chop some parsley and set aside too, When the chicken is done, remove from the pan and keep it warm
Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the same pan and add the mushroom slices
Stir and fry combining them with the chicken juices until nice and brown
Return the chicken to the pan and mix with the mushrooms
Sprinkle chopped parsley over everything
Serve over your favorite rice and dive in!
Good for 1 serving

name: Pancit Bihon
quantity: 2 bag of pancit bihon rice noodles
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat
Add onion and garlic; cook, stirring, until starting to soften, 2 to 3 minutes
Add pork and chicken; cook, stirring, until just cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes more
Transfer to a plate,Add broth, cabbage, snow peas, carrots and celery leaves to the pot
Bring to a simmer; cook until the vegetables are mostly tender, about 5 minutes
Add pancit bihon and cook, stirring, until the liquid is absorbed, 3 to 5 minutes
Stir in the pork and chicken; cook, stirring, until heated through, 2 minutes more
Stir in soy sauce and serve
Good for 1 serving

name: Sinabawang Gulay
instructions: Prepare and clean all the ingredients on the list
In a casserole, heat oil, brown the garlic, add ginger and onion until the onion becomes transparent
Add Suahe / Shrimp, saute until the color change to orange
Set aside only the shrimp,In same casserole, add water, let it boil
Add a little salt, add cubed squash, cover and let it simmer for 2 minutes
Add String beans / Sitaw, cover and let it simmer for another 2 minutes
Add Malunggay / Moringa leaves, cover and let it simmer for 1 minute
Add Shrimp, add more salt according to your desire saltness
Simmer for another 1 minute,Now serve while it's hot
Good for 2 -3 persons, perfect pair for fried fish
Good for 1 serving

name: Chicken and Vegetable Skewers
instructions: Thread chicken breast pieces and assorted vegetables like 3 cucumber and 3 potatoes onto skewers
Then grill or bake until cooked through
Good for 1 serving

name: Mango Coconut Smoothie
instructions: Blend mango, coconut milk, and then top with coconut flakes, and sliced fruit
Put it on a Glass and be refreshed
Good for 1 serving

name: Tuna Salad
instructions: Drain your tuna then add it to a mixing bowl along with the Greek yogurt, celery, onion, pickles, mayonnaise (optional), mustard, parsley, pepper and salt
Break up tuna chunks with a fork and stir until everything is well combined
Adjust flavor with extra salt, pepper, or mustard if needed
Serve immediately or chill in the fridge
Enjoy with crackers, as a sandwich, or on a salad
Store leftovers in a fridge for 3-5 days in an airtight container
Good for 1 serving

name: Fish Cardillo
quantity: 2 eggs beaten (1 for dip, 1 for sauce)
instructions: Thoroughly clean fish
Remove scale and gills, and wash thoroughly
Drain and set aside
Slice the raw fish into six pieces
Heat 4 teaspoons of vegetable oil in a frying pan
Place the ¼ cup flour into a bowl or plastic bag
Place the raw fish in the flour and cover the outside of each fish with flour
Sauté fish until golden brown
Set aside on top of a paper towel
Sauté 1 onion and 4 medium-sized tomatoes
Add 1⁄2 cup of water
Add the ½ cup beaten egg whites and fish Cover and let it simmer for 5–10 minutes
Season with ground pepper
Sprinkle with chopped green onions
Good for 1 serving

name: Veggie and Tofu Stir Fry with Rice
instructions: Add 3 tofu cubes and stir fry until golden brown
Remove tofu from the skillet and set aside
In the same skillet, stir fry vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, and carrots) until tender crisp
Add cooked tofu back to the skillet and toss everything together
Serve with rice
Good for 1 serving

name: Chicken and vegetable curry
instructions: Sauté diced chicken breast in oil until browned
Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger to the skillet and cook until fragrant
Stir in curry paste or powder and cook for a minute
Pour in 1 cup of  coconut milk and simmer until chicken is cooked through
Add chopped vegetables (such as potatoes, carrots, and peas) and simmer until tender
Serve hot with rice
Good for 1 serving

name: Paksiw na Bangus
instructions: In a pot, combine 1 cup water, 1/2 cup vinegar, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 onion, and 2 cloves garlic
Bring the mixture to a boil
Add sliced bangus and simmer until the fish is cooked and tender
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot with steamed vegetables or a side salad
Good for 1 serving

name: Vegetable and Chicken Stir Fry
instructions: Add chopped chicken and stir fry until golden brown
Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside
In the same skillet, stir fry vegetables (such as bell peppers and carrots) until tender crisp
Add cooked tofu back to the skillet and toss everything together
Season with stir fry sauce and serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Sinigang na Hipon
instructions: In a pot, bring 6 cups of water to a boil
Add 1 tomatoes and 1 onions and simmer for 5 minutes
Add 1 cup  radish and 1 cup eggplant, and cook until tender
Stir in the 2 tablespoons tamarind soup base
Add 1 pound shrimp and cook until they turn pink
Add 2 cups spinach or kangkong and cook until wilted
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot and enjoy this low-calorie, flavorful soup
Good for 1 serving

name: Pinakbet
instructions: In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat
Cook the pork until slightly browned
Add garlic, onions, and tomatoes
Sauté until tomatoes are wilted, Stir in squash and okra, cook for a minute, then add the rest of the vegetables
Pour in water and add shrimp paste
Bring to a boil, then simmer covered over low heat until vegetables are tender
Adjust the taste by adding more shrimp paste if needed
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving dish
Serve hot with steamed rice
Good for 1 serving

name: Banana and Peanut Butter Toast (This recipe may have a potential high fat content.)
instructions: Toast slices of bread until golden brown
Spread peanut butter over the toasted bread slices
Slice the 2 bananas and arrange them on top of the peanut butter
Good for 1 serving

name: Lemony Steamed Fish
quantity: 1 pinch seasoned salt, or more to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Cut six squares of aluminum foil large enough for each fillet
Center each fillet on a foil square
Season with dill, onion powder, parsley, paprika, seasoned salt, lemon-pepper seasoning, and garlic powder, then sprinkle with lemon juice
Fold the foil squares around the fillets to make pockets
Fold the edges to seal
Place sealed packets onto a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 30 minutes
Good for 1 serving

name: Egg Salad Sandwich
instructions: Chopped up the hard boiled eggs mixed with mayonnaise, mustard, and diced celery, serve it on whole grain bread to make it a sandwich
Good for 1 serving

name: Chop Suey
instructions: Prepare the Chicken:Slice the chicken breast thinly
Make the Sauce:Whisk together cornstarch, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and water
Cooking:Heat vegetable oil in a wok, Serving:Serve the chop suey immediately over rice
Good for 1 serving

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
quantity: 1 (8 ounce) can pineapple chunks, drained (juice reserved)
8 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1-inch cubes
2 green bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
instructions: Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper, then coat them evenly with cornstarch
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat
Add the chicken pieces and cook until golden brown and cooked through
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside
Add the diced bell pepper and onion
Cook until they begin to soften
Add the pineapple chunks to the skillet and cook
In a bowl, whisk together the ketchup, rice vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, minced garlic, and minced ginger
Pour the sauce mixture into the skillet with the vegetables and pineapple
Bring to a simmer
Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and toss to coat it evenly with the sauce
Serve it while hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Beef Caldereta
instructions: In a pot, brown beef cubes in oil
Add tomato sauce, liver spread, and enough water to cover the beef
Simmer until beef is tender
Add potatoes, carrots and bell peppers
Simmer until vegetables are cooked and sauce thickens
Serve hot with grated cheese on top, if desired
Good for 1 serving

name: Pork Sinigang
quantity: 8 pieces string beans cut into 2-inch pieces
Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a pot, bring water to a boil and add pork ribs or belly
Once pork is tender, add tamarind soup base or fresh tamarind
Add radish, eggplant, and string beans
Simmer until vegetables are cooked
Add spinach or kangkong leaves and cook for another minute
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Pancit Canton
instructions: In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant
Add pork belly and cook until lightly browned
Stir in shrimp and cook until pink
Add cabbage, and carrots
Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp
Add pre-soaked Canton noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce
Toss until well combined and noodles are heated through
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Sinigang na Isda
quantity: 1 40g pack Knorr Sinigang sa Sampaloc Mix (Original)
12 pieces sitaw snake beans, cut into 2 inch pieces
2 pieces long green pepper siling pansigang
instructions: Boil the water in a large cooking pot
Once the water starts to boil, add the tomatoes, kamias, and onion
Cover and let boil for 8 minutes
Add the fish (any type) and long green peppers
Cover and cook over medium heat for 10 to 12 minutes
Add the remaining ingredients including salt and pepper
Stir,Cover and let the heat cook the leaves for another 5 minutes
Good for 1 serving

name: Lemon Chicken
instructions: Make a marinade of ½ lemon juice, 3 green chillies, 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste, salt and pepper
Marinate the chicken in the marinade
Heat up a pan and add oil onto it
Fry the marinated chicken in the oil for 5 minutes
Once done, remove from heat and serve into a plate
Good for 1 serving

name: Chocolate Banana Oatmeal
instructions: Bring water and a pinch of regular salt to a boil in a small saucepan
Stir in oats, reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes
Remove from heat, cover and let stand for 2 to 3 minutes
Top with banana, chocolate spread and flaky salt
Good for 1 serving

name: Pork Menudo
quantity: 2 to 3 pieces dried bay leaves”,Salt and pepper to taste
instructions: Combine pork, soysauce, and lemon in a bowl
Marinate for at least 1 hour,Heat oil in a pan
Saute garlic and onion,Add the marinated pork
Cook for 5 to 7 minutes
Pour in tomato sauce and water and then add the bay leaves
Let boil and simmer for 30 minutes to an hour depending on the toughness of the pork
Note: Add water as necessary,Add-in the liver and hot dogs
Cook for 5 minutes
Put-in potatoes, carrots, sugar,salt, and pepper
Stir and cook for 8 to 12 minutes
Good for 1 serving

name: Simple Scrambled Eggs with Spinach and Cheese
instructions: Pour in the 3 whisked eggs and cook, stirring occasionally, until almost set
Sprinkle cheese over the eggs and continue cooking until the cheese melts
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginisang Gulay
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a pan over medium heat
Add 2 cloves of garlic and 1 onion, and sauté until fragrant
Add 2 cups mixed vegetables and cook until tender yet still crisp
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot as a side dish or with brown rice for a complete meal
Good for 1 serving

name: Lumpiang Gulay
quantity: 1 tbsp of soy sauce and oyster sauce
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened
Add the cabbage, carrot, jicama, green beans, and bean sprouts
Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender
Season with salt, pepper, soy sauce, and oyster sauce
In a small bowl, mix together the cornstarch and water
Add it to the pan and stir to combine
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the sauce has thickened
Remove the pan from the heat and let the filling cool
Wrap the filling in lumpia wrappers and deep-fry them until golden brown
In a small bowl, mix together the sweet chili sauce and white vinegar
Serve the Lumpiang Gulay with the sweet chili vinegar dipping sauce
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginisang Monggo
instructions: In a pan, put-in the water and bring to a boil
Put-in the Mung beans and simmer until becomes soft (about 35 to 50 minutes), On a separate pan, sauté the garlic,onion, and tomato
Add the pork
Cook for 5 mins
Put-in the beef cube and fish sauce
Simmer for 10 mins or until the meat is tender
Note: If necessary, you may add water to help make the meat tender but make sure to add more time to simmer
Add the shrimp
Stir and then cook for 2 minutes
Pour the cooked Mung beans
Stir and then simmer for 10 minutes, Add the spinach and pork rinds (chicharon)
Sprinkle the ground black pepper
Serve hot, Share and Enjoy!
Good for 1 serving

name: Banana Pancakes
instructions: Mash ripe bananas and mix them with 1 cup of flour, 2 eggs, 1 cup of milk, and a pinch of baking powder until you have a smooth batter
Cook the pancakes on a hot griddle or frying pan until golden brown on both sides
Serve it with toppings of butter
Good for 1 serving

name: Chicken and Cabbage Club Sandwich
instructions: Cook chicken breasts until fully cooked and slice them thinly
Toast bread slices and assemble the sandwich with layers of sliced chicken, shredded cabbage and top it all of mayonnaise
Good for 1 serving

name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp
instructions: In a bowl, combine lemon zest, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and pepper
Add the shrimp to the bowl and mix well to ensure the shrimp is well coated
Heat a pan over medium heat and add a little bit of oil
Add the shrimp mixture to the pan and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side or until the shrimp is pink and fully cooked
Serve the shrimp with your favorite vegetables to keep it lower carb, or with your favorite rice or pasta
Good for 1 serving

name: Lechon Paksiw
quantity: 4 lbs. leftover Lechon or Lechon kawali
instructions: In a pot, combine vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, onion, bay leaves, pepper, and salt
Add chopped lechon pieces to the pot
Simmer until the meat is tender and the sauce is thickened
Good for 1 serving

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Slice bell peppers, zucchini, mushrooms, and onions
Stir-fry vegetables in a pan with soy sauce
Cook until vegetables are tender
Good for 1 serving

name: Adobong sitaw
quantity: 1 lb string beans sitaw, cut in 2 inch length
instructions: In a pan, heat oil then add onions and garlic
When onion and garlic turns golden brown (not burnt), add the pork and stir occasionally until the pork is fully cooked
Add soy sauce and vinegar, Let it simmer
Once the mixture is simmering, add the string beans and stir slowly, allowing the sauce to fully incorporate with the string beans
Add salt and pepper according to your taste
Let it simmer for about 3-5 minutes more until the sitaw is tender, (Be careful not to let the string beans get overcooked!),Serve with hot steamed rice!
Good for 1 serving

name: Filipino chicken curry
quantity: 2 lbs. chicken cut into serving pieces
fish sauce and ground black pepper
instructions: Heat oil in a pan
Fry potato for 1 minute per side, Remove from the pan
Set aside
Using the remaining oil, saute garlic, onion, celery, and ginger until onion softens
Add the chicken pieces
Saute until the outer part of the chicken turns light brown
Add 1 tablespoon fish sauce
Continue sautéing for 1 minute,Pour-in coconut milk and water, Let boil
Add curry powder
Stir until the powder is completely diluted
Cover the pot and continue cooking between low to medium heat until the liquid reduces to half
Add the red bell pepper and pan fried-potato
Cook for 5 minutes
Season with fish sauce and ground black pepper as needed
You can also add all-purpose cream if desired
Good for 1 serving

name: Tinola
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat
Add onion, ginger and 6 cloves of garlic; cook, stirring, until the onion starts to turn translucent, about 3 minutes
Add chicken and broth; cook, stirring, until the chicken is just cooked through, about 5 minutes
Add papaya (or chayote), malunggay (or bok choy), 1 tbsp fish sauce, ¼ tsp salt and pepper; continue simmering until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded, about 5 minutes more
Good for 1 serving

name: Tinolang Manok
instructions: Saute ginger, garlic, and onions, Add chicken pieces and water
Simmer until chicken is tender
Add chili leaves or malunggay leaves
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper
Good for 1 serving

name: Lumpiang Shanghai
instructions: In a bowl, mix together ground pork, carrots, spring onions, garlic, onion, salt, and pepper
Place a spoonful of the mixture onto a lumpia wrapper and roll tightly, sealing the edges with water
Heat oil in a pan and fry the lumpia until golden brown and crispy
Serve with a dipping sauce of your choice
Good for 1 serving

name: Adobong Kangkong
quantity: 1tbsp of Soy sauce”, 1tbsp of vinegar”,5pcs of Garlic
instructions: In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant
Add pork belly or chicken and cook until lightly browned
Pour soy sauce, vinegar, and add bay leaves
Simmer until meat is tender
Add kangkong and cook until wilted
Season with pepper to taste
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Sotanghon Guisado
instructions: Soak sotanghon noodles in water until softened, then drain
In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant
Add chicken and shrimp, cook until lightly browned
Add carrots and cabbage, cook until vegetables are tender
Pour soy sauce, fish sauce, and chicken broth
Bring to a simmer, Add sotanghon noodles and cook until heated through
Season with pepper to taste
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Pininyahang Manok
instructions: In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned
Pour coconut milk and add pineapple chunks
Simmer until chicken is cooked through and sauce thickens
Add bell pepper and season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Inihaw na Pusit
quantity: Salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, mix together soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, onion, calamansi juice, salt, and pepper
Marinate squid in the mixture for at least 30 minutes
Grill squid over hot charcoal or on a grill pan until cooked and slightly charred
Baste with marinade while grilling
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginisang Labanos
instructions: In a pan, sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until softened
Add pork belly and cook until lightly browned
Add sliced radish and stir-fry until tender
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper
Serve hot
Good for 1 serving

name: Pinais
instructions: Season the fish with salt
Stuff the fish (Tulingan) cavity with lemongrass, ginger, and tomatoes
Wrap the fish in banana leaves securely
Steam the wrapped fish until cooked
Good for 1 serving

name: Pochero
instructions: Sauté garlic and onions in a pot
Add the beef and brown on all sides
Pour in tomato sauce and enough water to cover the beef
Simmer until beef is tender, Add potatoes, carrots, cabbage and saba bananas
Cook until vegetables are tender
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Good for 1 serving

name: Salmon-Stuffed Avocados
quantity: 1 pinch of salt and ground black pepper
instructions: Combine yogurt, celery, parsley, lime juice, mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl, mix well
Add salmon and mix well
Halve avocados lengthwise and remove pits
Scoop about 1 tablespoon flesh from each avocado half into a small bowl
Mash the scooped-out avocado flesh with a fork and stir into the salmon mixture.
Fill each avocado half with about 1/4 cup of the salmon mixture, mounding it on top of the avocado halves
Garnish with chives, if desired.
Good for 1 serving

name: Avocado Deviled Eggs
quantity: 1 tablespoon sour cream (can skip if you need dairy free)
1 tablespoon chopped chives or green onion
instructions: Carefully remove egg yolks from egg whites using a spoon
place the yolks in a medium bowl
Place egg white halves on a large plate
Add avocado, 2 tablespoons chives, mayonnaise, lime juice, mustard, paprika and salt to the bowl with the egg yolks
Mix and mash thoroughly with a fork until smooth
Spoon the egg yolk mixture evenly into each egg white half (about 1 tablespoon each)
(Alternatively, place the egg yolk mixture in a pastry bag, or a zip-top bag with a 1/4-inch corner cut off, and pipe the filling into the egg white halves)
Garnish each egg half with bacon (if using), pickled red onions and the remaining 1 tablespoon chives, Sprinkle with crushed red pepper, if desired
Good for 1 serving

name: Pistachio & Peach Toast
instructions: Combine ricotta
½ teaspoon honey and cinnamon in a small bowl
Spread the ricotta mixture on toast and top with peach and pistachios
Drizzle with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon honey
Good for 1 serving

name: Sheet-Pan Sausage & Peppers
quantity: 2 chopped bell pepper and red onion
1 tsp of black pepper”, “1 pinch of black pepper”, “2 tbsp of kosher”, “3 cloves of garlic”, “2 grated parmesan cheese
instructions: Place a large rimmed baking sheet in oven
preheat oven to 425 degrees F
Toss together onion, bell peppers, fennel, oil, black pepper and salt in a large bowl
Arrange vegetable mixture in a single layer on preheated baking sheet
Bake in preheated oven until vegetables begin to soften, about 10 minutes
Remove baking sheet from oven and toss vegetable mixture
Add sausage and garlic to baking sheet
Return to oven, and bake at 425 degrees F until sausage is warmed through and vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes
Remove from oven; sprinkle with cheese, basil and crushed red pepper
Good for 1 serving

name: Sheet-Pan Sausage & Peppers
quantity: 2 chopped bell pepper and red onion
1 tsp of black pepper”, “1 pinch of black pepper
2 tbsp of kosher”, “3 cloves of garlic”, “2 grated parmesan cheese
instructions: Place a large rimmed baking sheet in oven
preheat oven to 425 degrees F
Toss together onion, bell peppers, fennel, oil, black pepper and salt in a large bowl
Arrange vegetable mixture in a single layer on preheated baking sheet
Bake in preheated oven until vegetables begin to soften, about 10 minutes
Remove baking sheet from oven and toss vegetable mixture
Add sausage and garlic to baking sheet
Return to oven, and bake at 425 degrees F until sausage is warmed through and vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes
Remove from oven; sprinkle with cheese, basil and crushed red pepper
Good for 1 serving

name: Peanut Butter & Berries Waffle Sandwich (This recipe may have a potential high fat content.)
quantity: ¼ cup fresh mixed berries, such as raspberries, strawberries and blackberries
instructions: Slice waffle in half down the center
Spread peanut butter over one half
Place berries in a small bowl and smash with the back of a fork
Spread on top of the peanut butter layer and then drizzle with honey
Top with the remaining waffle half
Good for 1 serving

name: Laing
quantity: 1/2 cup shrimp paste bagoong or balaw
instructions: Combine the coconut milk, pork, shrimp paste, ginger, onion, and garlic in a cooking pot
Heat the pot and let boil
Once the mixture starts to boil, gently stir to mix the ingredients
Cover the pot and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes
Make sure to stir once in a while to prevent the ingredients from sticking on the bottom of the cooking pot
Add the dried taro leaves
Do not stir, Let it stay until the leaves absorb the coconut milk
This takes about 20 to 30 minutes
You can gently push the leaves down so that it can absorb more coconut milk
Once the leaves absorb the coconut milk, stir the leaves and then continue to cook for to 10 minutes
Pour the coconut cream into the cooking pot
Add the red chilies
Stir, Cook for 10 to 12 minutes
Transfer to a serving plate, Serve
Good for 1 serving

name: Ginisang Ampalaya
quantity: 2 chopped onions”, “2 chopped tomatoes”, “1 pinch of salt and black pepper”, “2 tbsp of cooking oil
instructions: Slice the bitter melon into thin, half crescent shaped pieces
Now soak the bitter melon in salted water for 10 minutes
Remove the bitter melon from the salt water and squeeze it with your hands slightly to remove some of the bitter taste
Then rinse the bitter melon and set it aside
In a bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt to taste
Add the cooking oil to a large pan over medium-high heat
Now add the garlic and onion and stir occasionally
Saute this for a minute then add the tomato
Saute for another minute then add the bitter melon
Stir occasionally until the bitter melon is tender but do not overcook
Pour the eggs into the pan then stir
Cook this until eggs are scrambled
Remove the pan from the heat and serve the food on a serving dish
Good for 1 serving

name: Bulanglang
quantity: 1 pinch of salt and black pepper
instructions: In a pot add oil and pork then cook until brown and crispy
Remove from pot then set aside
Add garlic and onion and sauté for a minute; add tomatoes and sauté until it becomes soft
Add butternut squash stir fry for 2 minutes
Add bottle grourd and okra then stir fry for 2 minutes
Add loofah then stir fry for 2 minutes
Pour in rice wash then add the browned pork, shrimps, bagoong and spinach / moringa leaves, bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes or until vegetables are cooked
Season with freshly ground black pepper then serve
Good for 1 serving

name: Scrambled Egg Toast
quantity: ½ tbsp butter, plus more to butter the bread
instructions: Spread a thin layer of softened butter on both sides of the bread
Fry the bread over medium heat for about 2 minutes on each side, until a golden brown crust forms
Alternatively, you can use a toaster or toaster oven to toast your bread
Remove the bread from the frying pan and add ½ tbsp, of butter
Add the eggs, and cook, add a pinch of salt for flavor on medium-low heat, stirring often, for about 3-4 minutes, until the eggs are cooked through
Divide the eggs between the bread slices and garnish as you desire
Good for 1 serving
